content:
I am a sophomore math major at Carnegie Mellon University. I am broadly interested in Analysis, Machine Learning, and Statistics. In summer 2020, I worked with Professor Jay Newby at the University of Alberta to estimate the probability hypothesis density (PHD) of the movement of particles in videos using convolutional neural networks. In summer 2019, I interned at Matrix Retail, speeding up sales forecasting for 1000+ retail stores by 300% while maintaining accuracy of the previous forecasting algorithm.
I am Vice President of Projects for the CMU Data Science Club and enjoy teaching.
